Text.Value: Good luck getting a blue copper out of Lorroakan. Guy's tighter than a blacknose sheep.

EditorData.stateContext: Aradin has back to player, is talking to animated armour

Text.Value: I can knock you out if the noise is bothering you.
Guy was a prick. So were you, if memory serves.
How dumb do you think I am? You're hiding her. Can't blame you for wanting the reward for yourself.
Why don't you move along before you start regretting hanging around?
I've lost good people to the wizard that owns that shop. Lorroakan. Offered a huge pile of cash to chase down some relic called the 'Nightsong'.
Last time I saw you, I'd cleaned your clock.
Turns out his little relic was in a temple of Shar, beneath an army of goblins. Would never have taken my people in if I'd known.
Sorry; I didn't find anything.
If she's out there, I'm gonna find her. You mark my words.
I lost good people. Good friends. The 'Nightsong' my arse.
I thought about what you said before, by the way. About Tyr. Wondered if I might've missed a trick, not having a god in my corner.
Son of a bastard's whore. You had a small fortune in your grasp, and you let it go?!
Don't I know you?
Lorroakan said it'd be easy money - a smash and grab. Get in, get the Nightsong, go.
She is a being of divine origin under my protection - you will go nowhere near her.
She is a divine being - and I'll cut you down if you go anywhere near her.
I have greater plans for the Nightsong - go near her and I'll kill you.
Piss off.
Last time I saw you, you'd cleaned the clock of a tiefling named Zevlor.
I can't bring 'em back. But I can make Lorroakan cough up. Especially if you found the relic.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sadly, through his tough mean exterior. (loh-ROW-ah-kun)

Text.Value: Lorroakan - the wizard who set out the contract. He owns this place. And his little pageboy inside knows how to get to him.
I found the Nightsong, actually. Turns out it wasn't a relic, but an aasimar.
Last time I saw you, you'd been knocked out by a tiefling named Zevlor.
Don't know. Don't care. But he did offer a king's ransom for its return.
I'm sorry to hear about your friends.
You're lucky I'm not in the mood for payback.
Let me back in, or bring Lorroakan out here, you tin tube.
Get out of my face.

EditorData.NodeContext: Very aggro, ready to fight the player.

Text.Value: To chase the Nightsong is to once more rush into danger - reflect on your past mistakes.
What's going on here?
Hope you lost fewer people along the way than I did. Bloody goblins. Lorroakan should've warned us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Second part said as though to Lorroakan in the shop he's trying to enter.

Text.Value: I'm not losing any more people. Not any good ones, anyway.
Immortal, eh? Interesting. Won't be easy getting her back to the wizard, but if you don't do it, someone else will.
You tell Lorroakan I went for his godsdamned Nightsong, and now he has to pay up. What're you looking at?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: On "What're you looking at?" Aradin notices player and turns to face them
EditorData.NodeContext: First line to Klank, second line to player

Text.Value: But then I started to wonder why I'd worship someone who had the power to help people, but chose not to unless they bowed before him. You can't answer me that, can you?
An aasimar... you found it?! Where is it?

EditorData.NodeContext: On 'an aasimar,' he's surprised, coming to terms with this fact quickly. ('AH-sim-ar')

Text.Value: Hope you hid it well, mate.
You're lying. Can't say I blame you. Thing's worth a fortune.
What's your problem?
See you around, mate.
Hope you hid her well, mate.

EditorData.NodeContext: Meancing. He's going to find her.

Text.Value: Shit, it's you. You went looking for the Nightsong after me. Please tell me you found it.
Attack.
Should have pounded that rustbucket into scrap as soon as it kicked me out of the shop.
Only place I'm going is wherever you've got the aasimar stashed.
Oh yeah. That prick. You should probably get out of my way unless you want the same treatment.
I gave your boy Helm a shot, you know. Stopped by a shrine of his. Even offered up a copper. And do you know what I got in return? One less copper.
I'm looking at the idiot making all the noise.
Answer the question. Did you find it or not?
I'll need to see who's around. But with cash like what Lorroakan's offering, I don't think I'll have any trouble recruiting help.
Lorroakan. Wizard that owns that shop. Sent me on a wild goose chase into a hive of goblins for some relic. Said it would be an easy take.
Leave.
Last time I saw you, you almost came to blows with Zevlor back in the druid's grove.
Still alive, is she? You better be telling the truth, and you better not get in my way.
Don't get ahead of yourself. Lorroakan wanted her alive - and she's dead.
You get that money, you come find me. Or I'll come looking for you.
'Sorry' won't bring 'em back, pay their debts, or compensate me for my trouble.
Watch your mouth.
She's in my camp. If you want to turn her in, you're going to have to take her down yourself.
I ought to knock some sense into you, but you know what? I'm too godsdamn tired.
Prruh...
Sod it. Enough. Lorroakan and his precious Nightsong just about ruined my life. If you value yours, I'd steer well clear of this place.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grim and sarcastic on the 'good luck, pal.' (loh-ROW-ah-kun)

Text.Value: Who are you trying to get at inside?
But it won't do me no good. So if you're looking for a 'thank you', look somewhere else.
And I suppose you were stupid enough to kill her?
She's gone - I'm not sure where to.

EditorData.logicalname: Nightsong not in camp, but not dead

Text.Value: Maybe. I don't know you, though. And I'd thank you to get out of my face.
She's immortal. And tough. You can forget about turning her in for a reward.
I found the Nightsong. Turns out it wasn't a relic, but an aasimar.
I tried praying to your fella Tempus, by the way. Down on my knees and everything. Felt like a fool. Still do.
If he'd mentioned it was buried under a goblin hive, I'd never have taken my people there. He owes me. A lot.
She's gone - I'm not sure where to.

EditorData.logicalname: Ability_Deception - lie. NS is in camp

Text.Value: An aasimar? Hells. If I'd known, I'd have asked for more gold - kidnapping costs more than theft.
Don't forget I'm the one who gave you that contract. I want my cut.
What does he want with the Nightsong?
She's long gone by now. There's no reward to be had.

EditorData.logicalname: Nightsong not dead but not at camp

Text.Value: That's none of your business.
I haven't been paid yet.

Synopsis:
Aradin is yelling to Klank because it is blocking the entrance to the Sorcerous Sundries shop. Aradin asks the player whether they had success on the quest of the nightsong and leaves.

LORR-oh-AH-kan.
